title.narrative: Support for promotion of democracy and good governance in Indonesia.

description.narrative:
The Danish Government allocated 50 mil. DKK. to strengthen democracy and good governance in Indonesia, promotion of democratic and rights-based civic values, as well as countering trans-national crime and curbing corruption during the period of 2010-2013. MRD3 is the third phase of Denmark's support to human rights, democratization, anti-corruption and good governance in Indonesia, which has been initiated in 2007. MRD3 consists of 4 components:
1.Strengthening of civic values through religious institutions and the police in Indonesia. This component is implemented by The Asia Foundation (TAF) and its 10 Indonesian NGO-partners. The objective of this component is to advance democratic governance and human rights through police, religious leaders and civil society.
2.Countering trans-national crime, through support to Jakarta Centre for Law Enforcement Cooperation (JCLEC). The objective of this support is to increased capacity of Indonesian and regional law enforcement agencies to combat trans-national crime, through law enforcement training to the Indonesian Police, regional law enforcement agencies and other sectors of the criminal justice community.
3.Strengthening good governance and anti-corruption, in cooperation with Transparency International Indonesia (TII). The objective of this component is to improve the management of national public resources to increase public welfare.
4.Strengthening organizational capacity and democratization, is a contribution to a trust fund with the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands to Partnership for Governance Reform (Kemitraan). The support is addressed to Kemitraan¿s program on Leveraging and Educating Accountable Democracy in Indonesia (LEAD), in particular support to Component 1 of the LEAD: establishing substantive democracy through political reform and education.
